Text: The total assessed value of Westbank lands rose more than 600 per cent (after inflation) from 2005 to 2019. Most of that value has been created by holders of certificates (now known as allotments) leasing their lands for residential development, while the Westbank government has also leased community land for commercial projects such as shopping centres.
Cause: Most of that value has been created by holders of certificates (now known as allotments) leasing their lands for residential development, while the Westbank government has also leased community land for commercial projects such as shopping centres.
Effect: The total assessed value of Westbank lands rose more than 600 per cent (after inflation) from 2005 to 2019.
Sentence: <e2>The total assessed value of Westbank lands rose more than 600 per cent (after inflation) from 2005 to 2019.</e2> <e1>Most of that value has been created by holders of certificates (now known as allotments) leasing their lands for residential development, while the Westbank government has also leased community land for commercial projects such as shopping centres.</e1>
